Review Text: Scenic waterfall which is accessed after a steep 500 meter descent made up of steps. Entrance is paid but before 8am access is free. If you are coming from Colombo towards the hinterland, it is worth a visit

Review Title: My family went to have a bath top of Waterfall  very exciting  experience which  never forget
Review Text: Most beautiful   Waterfall experience  ,can bath in clean cool water stream. Top of Waterfall is piece of hewn,  must see place

Review Title: Bit of a drive, beautiful waterfall
Review Text: The drive up is a bit.. Interesting. Thank you to our driver for getting us there and back :) It is quite easy to miss, it is on the right of the sign that has the information on it. The path to the viewing is not so bad but if you plan on going to the bottom, be prepared with long trousers as it is very overgrown! We went up and parked up by the tea factory and caught a tuctuc to the entrance and had a wander down to the view point. Even in the dry period it looked pretty cool!

Wonderful waterfall. However, this is not much famous in travelers. Around 100 steps down to the view point of the waterfall. But, if you want more adventure, you can go to the bottom of the fall. The route is not well cleared, because not much travelers use this. Anyway, this is a place you must go.

7th Highest Waterfall in Sri Lanka, Kirindi Ella creates an absolutely breathtaking view during the rainy season. Kuttapitiya road (the last 7KM ride to the waterfall) is very narrow and but in fine condition (as of June 2018).

This is not the easiest of waterfalls to get to but is worth the effort if you are in this area. It is in the Pelmadulla area, several kilometers off the Badulla-Colombo main road. The road to the falls is not good but is accessible by vehicle.As with all falls, it is spectacular in the rainy season. The area has significant rainfall during several months of the year which adds to the likelihood of poor road surfaces and mud-slides but contributes to the wonderful lush green surroundings of these falls which adds to the overall beauty. The spectacular nature of the falls can be viewed from a reasonable distance or one can reach the falls by walking from the nearest place a vehicle may be parked.

This is a hidden remarkable spot which you should definitely try. A huge amount of water is flowing through this waterfall.  Located at palmadulla. You can easily find it on google maps. Road is very good for any Vehicle.  Surrounding environment is also very nice along the way. Of you are in good physical condition you should  definitely try going to the bottom of watetfall. You can surely have a nice cool bath from here. The path is very sloppy. Highly recommend place. One of the best waterfall in Sri Lanka.

A must do if you are in the area. You can walk across the river get your legs wet to see a great view of the falls. It cools you down. A good tip if you are driving or have a driver is to go all the way down the lane and park up at the hotel at the bottom and buy a few drinks before the short walk to the waterfall. The lane on the way down is very bumpy typical Sri Lankan style.

Review Title: A remarkable waterfall in Sri Lanka
Review Text: This waterfall is located at Pelmadulla area. When you will be travelling in Colombo - Badulla road via Rathnapura, you have to turn left at the junction just before the Pelmadulla town towards the where Gankanna Central College located. There is a drive of about 6 km in that road to reach out to this waterfall. The road condition is not much good but possible to use a car. Please keep in mind that the read is a narrow road with bends. There is a name board in the road after driving about 7km in that road. You have to park your vehicle at a side of a road (no dedicated car park) and have to walk down from the road. After walking about 50m in that foot path (cement stair case is there), there is a view point which you can have a nice view of the waterfall. If you would like to go closer to the waterfall you have to walk more distance from that point. But it depends on your physical fitness. I have heard that is is possible to reach out to the top of the waterfall too. But still could not try it. This is a waterfall with the height of about 116m. The water stream connects to the Kalu Ganga at a later point.
